steps.value: This is the diamond plot. The axis here represents the rank for different types for a pair of systems. If, say, {{topName2023}} and {{secondName2023}} were very frequent both now and then, exactly as frequent, they will rank both high on the axis, and sit on the diagonal.

As we saw {{topName1980}} was the most popular baby name in 1980, while it was ranked much lower in 2023. Now, you'll notice that as you hover on less frequent types, they tend to have more types in it. This is because each cell represents the number of times a baby names appear; there is only one {{topName2023}}, appearing hundred or thousand times, while there are many names that appear only once or twice, like {{lastName1980}} or {{secondLastName1990}}. The legend is indicating the scale, with darker color showing there are more counts per cell.

We now add 2023 to examine the shift in popularity. The bottom right plot help keeping track of the contribution from each system in the shared vocabulary, as we throw out any names that are not shared between the two systems. As discussed in the analysis, we can see that {{surpriseName}} was in the tail in 1980, before ranking much higher in 2023.
